Detailed Description

Script to emulate a GPS signal for other nodes.

As of this point, ROS Noetic does not support the Hector GPS plugin. Instead, this module makes use of the ground truth position data from the robot and republishes it with additional gaussian noise. In order to emulate a GPS, the conversion function for the particular simulation still has to be implemented. The logic behind this module is that other nodes on the robot receive a pseudo GPS signal to work with in their localization algorithms. This signal can't be provided from outside, so the robot itself publishes a noisy estimation of what a GPS signal would look like on its current position.
